chapter.title: Intercepting Operations
chapter.para: HornetQ supports interceptors to intercept packets entering the server. Any supplied interceptors would be called for any packet entering the server, this allows custom code to be executed, e.g. for auditing packets, filtering or other reasons. Interceptors can change the packets they intercept.

section.title: Implementing The Interceptors
section.para: A interceptor must implement the Interceptor interface:
The returned boolean value is important:

listitem.para: if true is returned, the process continues normally
if false is returned, the process is aborted, no other interceptors will be called and the packet will not be handled by the server at all.

section.title: Configuring The Interceptors
section.para: The interceptors are configured in hornetq-configuration.xml:
The interceptors classes (and their dependencies) must be added to the server classpath to be properly instantiated and called.

section.title: Interceptors on the Client Side
section.para: The interceptors can also be run on the client side to intercept packets sent by the server by adding the interceptor to the ClientSessionFactory with the addInterceptor() method.
The interceptors classes (and their dependencies) must be added to the client classpath to be properly instantiated and called from the client side.
